The shinythemes package makes it easy to apply Bootstrap themes to your Shiny applications.


```{r echo=FALSE}
# Generate the carousel
images <- c("default", "cerulean", "cosmo", "flatly", "journal", "readable",
            "spacelab", "united")

generateTabTags <- function(images) {  
  vapply(images, function(image) {
    # Capitalize first letter
    label <- paste0(toupper(substring(image, 1, 1)), substring(image, 2))
  
    sprintf('
      <li role="presentation"><a href="#%s">%s</a></li>
      ', image, label
    )
  }, FUN.VALUE = character(1))
}

generateItemTags <- function(images) {  
  vapply(images, function(image) {
    sprintf('
      <div role="tabpanel" class="tab-pane" id="%s">
        <img src="images/%s.png" class="screenshot-image">
      </div>
      ', image, image
    )
  }, FUN.VALUE = character(1))
}

output <- paste0(c('
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-sm-2">
    <ul id="themeTabs" class="nav nav-pills nav-stacked">',
    generateTabTags(images), '
    </ul>
  </div>

  <div class="tab-content col-sm-10">',
    generateItemTags(images), '
  </div>
</div>

<script>
  // Cycle through tabs automatically
  var tabChange = function() {
      var tabs = $(".nav-pills > li");
      var active = tabs.filter(".active");
      var next = active.next("li").length ?
                  active.next("li").find("a") :
                  tabs.filter(":first-child").find("a");
      next.tab("show");
      tabCycle = setTimeout(tabChange, 4000);
  };
  var tabCycle = setTimeout(tabChange, 4000);

  // If user clicks on a tab, stop cycling it and activate
  $("#themeTabs li a").each(function() {
    $(this).click(function (e) {
      e.preventDefault();
      clearInterval(tabCycle);
      $(this).tab("show");

      // Automatically start cycling tabs after a delay
      tabCycle = setTimeout(tabChange, 12000);
    });
  });

  // On page load, activate first tab
  $(function () {
    $("#themeTabs a:first").tab("show");
  });
  </script>
'), collapse = "\n")

knitr::asis_output(htmltools::htmlPreserve(output))
```
